reasoning: Gammopathy is a heterogeneous category including monoclonal and polyclonal disorders. Using MGUS (monoclonal gammopathy of undetermined significance) as primary reference: incidence ~3.5 per 100k, prevalence ~3.5% of population (35,000 per 100k). Confidence limited by heterogeneity within category and varying clinical significance of subcategories.
source: Kyle RA et al. (2006). Prevalence of monoclonal gammopathy of undetermined significance. N Engl J Med. 354(13):1362-1369
